node.title: 'This is a nightmare': Woman faces backlash after plea for help over claustrophobic MIQ room
node.description: The post was screenshotted and circulated on Twitter, warranting some cruel responses.
node.content: ["A woman has faced backlash after her plea for help over claustrophobic Managed Isolation and Quarantine room went viral.", "The woman was staying in the Rydges MIQ facility in Auckland with another person and two small children.", "The family of four were made to share one room with two double beds.", "\"To say this is a nightmare is an understatement,\" she posted on Facebook. \"I have been told the hotel is full so they can't give us adjoining rooms and the kids are going to have to share the bed.\"\u00a0", "\"Please share any advice or help, I just locked myself in the bathroom to cry, feeling so anxious and claustrophobic.\"\u00a0", "The woman posted on a Facebook group called New Zealand Hotel Quarantine, aimed at providing support, chat and advice for people in MIQ.", "But instead of support, the post was screenshotted and circulated on Twitter, warranting some cruel responses.", "\"Cry me a river,\" One Twitter user said.", "\"So over these pampered, ungrateful arseholes!\" Another user said.", "\"Just spent two weeks in a campervan with family and the kids sharing a bed, this looks so spacious in comparison,\" a user Tweeted.", "\"I like the way her response to alleged claustrophobia is to find a second, much smaller room to go and cry in,\" one person wrote.", "Some Twitter users said the woman should be thankful she got an MIQ spot.", "\"I'm sick of people complaining about MIQ. My son would give his eye teeth to have a space in MIQ to be able to come home,\" a\u00a0 user said.", "\"For some people this would be a really tough situation. However MIQ is really limited and this is the opportunity for them and other people really want and need. So these people really need to suck it up and get on with it,\" another user said.", "A few people, however, were supportive of the woman.", "\"The responses to this Tweet are awful,\" One said. \"Everyone is saying she's so lucky to have two beds and time in a hotel. They can't leave that room. There's nothing remotely 'holiday' about 4 people being stuck in a room together\u2026 When did people get so f***ing vile.\"", "The woman has since taken to Instagram saying in a post she is \"surrendering\" to the process.", "\"It's been tricky coming back into MIQ (managed quarantine) after skipping around Australia freely for the past few weeks. My brain can't quite wrap around the inconsistent processes and logic being applied around the world. I'm surrendering,\" The NZ Herald reported she wrote.", "\"I do believe everything happens for a reason so I'm finding the joy in being given a fully catered staycation that's actually within radius of Uber eats\u00a0", "MIQ stays have been tough on some Kiwi's mental health, with clinical psychologist Jacqui Maguire warning the impacts of MIQ on some people's mental health are \"not to be underestimated\"."]
